footer.tagline: Professional legal document generation platform powered by AI. Create, manage, and sign documents with confidence.

regional.title: UAE & GCC Region
regional.notice: Qannoni is a software platform designed for the UAE and GCC markets. All documents should be reviewed by qualified legal professionals familiar with local laws and regulations before use in legal matters.

disclaimer.title: Legal Disclaimer
disclaimer.importantNotice: IMPORTANT: Please read this disclaimer carefully before using Qannoni. By using our platform, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by this disclaimer.

criticalWarning.title: Critical Warning
criticalWarning.subtitle: Qannoni is a SOFTWARE COMPANY, NOT a law firm or legal service provider.
criticalWarning.point1: We do NOT provide legal advice, legal representation, or legal services of any kind
criticalWarning.point2: We are NOT attorneys, lawyers, or legal professionals
criticalWarning.point3: We do NOT create attorney-client relationships with our users
criticalWarning.point4: Our platform is a TECHNOLOGY TOOL for document generation, NOT a substitute for legal counsel

natureOfService.title: Nature of Our Service
natureOfService.description: Qannoni is a software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform that provides technology tools for creating, managing, and signing documents. We are a technology company, not a legal services provider.
natureOfService.item1: Document template libraries and generation tools
natureOfService.item3: Electronic signature and document management features
natureOfService.notItem3: Review or validation of legal documents for compliance

noAttorneyClient.title: No Attorney-Client Relationship
noAttorneyClient.statement: Use of Qannoni does NOT create an attorney-client relationship.
noAttorneyClient.explanation: No attorney-client relationship exists between you and Qannoni, its owners, employees, contractors, or affiliated entities. The information provided through our platform:
noAttorneyClient.point1: Is for general informational purposes only
noAttorneyClient.point2: Does not constitute legal advice or legal services
noAttorneyClient.point3: Should not be relied upon as legal guidance
noAttorneyClient.point4: Cannot replace consultation with a qualified attorney

templates.title: Templates and AI-Generated Content
templates.description: All document templates and AI-generated content provided by Qannoni are generic forms intended for informational purposes only. They are NOT tailored to your specific legal needs or circumstances.
templates.aiWarning: AI-generated documents may contain errors, omissions, or inappropriate content. Always review and verify all AI-generated content.
templates.point1: Templates are starting points, not finished legal documents
templates.point2: AI-generated content may not be accurate, complete, or suitable for your needs
templates.point3: Templates may not comply with current laws in your jurisdiction
templates.point4: Using our templates does not guarantee legal validity or enforceability

userResponsibility.title: Your Responsibility
userResponsibility.point1: Reviewing all documents for accuracy, completeness, and legal compliance
userResponsibility.point2: Consulting with qualified legal professionals before using any document
userResponsibility.point3: Ensuring documents comply with applicable laws and regulations
userResponsibility.point4: Understanding the legal implications of any document you create or sign
userResponsibility.point5: Making informed decisions about your legal matters

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.statement: TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, QANNONI DISCLAIMS ALL LIABILITY.
liability.description: Qannoni, its owners, employees, contractors, and affiliated entities shall not be liable for any damages, losses, or consequences arising from:
liability.point1: Use or inability to use our platform or services
liability.point2: Reliance on any templates, documents, or information provided
liability.point3: Errors, omissions, or inaccuracies in AI-generated content
liability.point4: Legal disputes, invalid documents, or unenforceable agreements

regional.title: UAE & GCC Specific Disclaimers
regional.subtitle: Important notices for users in the United Arab Emirates and GCC countries

uae.title: United Arab Emirates
uae.point1: Our templates are NOT reviewed or approved by UAE legal authorities
uae.point2: Documents may require notarization, attestation, or other formalities under UAE law
uae.point3: Certain documents may need to be in Arabic to be legally enforceable
uae.point4: Free zones, mainland, and offshore jurisdictions have different legal requirements

gcc.title: GCC Countries
gcc.point1: Laws vary significantly between GCC countries (UAE, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Bahrain, Oman, Qatar)
gcc.point2: Our templates may not comply with specific national or emirate-level regulations
gcc.point3: Always consult local legal counsel familiar with the specific jurisdiction

recommendation.title: Our Strong Recommendation
recommendation.statement: We STRONGLY RECOMMEND that you consult with qualified legal professionals before using any document for legal purposes.
recommendation.whenToConsult: You should ALWAYS consult a lawyer when:
recommendation.case1: The document involves significant financial transactions or obligations
recommendation.case2: The matter involves complex legal issues or regulations
recommendation.case3: The document could significantly impact your legal rights
recommendation.case4: You are unsure about any aspect of the document or its legal implications
recommendation.case5: The document will be used in official proceedings or with government entities

changes.title: Changes to This Disclaimer
changes.description: We reserve the right to modify this disclaimer at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting. Your continued use of Qannoni after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified disclaimer.

contact.title: Questions About This Disclaimer
contact.description: If you have questions about this disclaimer or our services, please contact us:

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.commitment: Your privacy is important to us. This policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal information.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.p1: Qannoni ("we", "our", "us") is committed to protecting your privacy and personal data. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store, and share information when you use our platform.
introduction.p2: By using Qannoni, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. If you do not agree with this policy, please do not use our services.

personal.title: Personal Information
personal.item2: Company information (name, trade license, tax number)
personal.item3: Payment information (processed securely by third-party providers)
personal.item4: Identity verification data (Emirates ID, passport for verification features)

documents.item1: Document text, data entered into templates

usage.title: How We Use Your Information
usage.purpose4: Generate AI-powered document suggestions and content
usage.purpose5: Detect and prevent fraud and abuse
usage.purpose7: Communicate updates, security alerts, and support messages

storage.title: Data Storage and Security

location.title: Storage Location
location.description: Your data is stored securely on cloud servers provided by Supabase, with data centers located in regions that ensure optimal performance and compliance.

encryption.title: Encryption
encryption.description: We use industry-standard encryption (TLS/SSL) for data in transit and AES-256 encryption for data at rest. Passwords are hashed using bcrypt.

backup.title: Backups
backup.description: Regular automated backups are performed to prevent data loss. Backups are encrypted and stored securely.

storage.security: While we implement strong security measures, no system is 100% secure. We cannot guarantee absolute security of your data.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Services
thirdParty.description: We use trusted third-party service providers to operate our platform. These providers may have access to your data only to perform tasks on our behalf and are obligated to protect it.

openrouter.purpose: AI model access for document generation and legal assistance

supabase.purpose: Database hosting, authentication, and storage services

thirdParty.aiWarning: When using AI features, your prompts and document content may be processed by AI providers (OpenRouter/OpenAI). These providers have their own privacy policies.

cookies.title: Cookies and Tracking
cookies.description: We use cookies and similar technologies to improve your experience and analyze platform usage.

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.description: Required for authentication, security, and core platform functionality

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies

cookies.control: You can control cookies through your browser settings, but disabling essential cookies may affect platform functionality.

rights.subtitle: You have the following rights regarding your personal data (subject to applicable laws):

access.description: Request a copy of your personal data

portability.description: Receive your data in a structured format

deletion.title: Right to Deletion
deletion.description: Request deletion of your data (with exceptions)

rights.exercise: To exercise these rights, contact us at

retention.title: Data Retention
retention.description: We retain your data for as long as necessary to provide services and comply with legal obligations:
retention.account: Account data: Retained while your account is active, plus 90 days after deletion
retention.documents: Document data: Retained for 7 years or as required by law
retention.logs: Access and security logs: Retained for 90 days
retention.analytics: Anonymous analytics: Retained indefinitely for platform improvement

children.title: Children's Privacy
children.description: Qannoni is not intended for users under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If we become aware of such data collection, we will delete it promptly.

international.title: International Data Transfers
international.description: Your data may be transferred to and processed in countries outside the UAE. We ensure appropriate safeguards are in place for international data transfers.
international.protection: We use Standard Contractual Clauses and other mechanisms approved by data protection authorities to protect your data during international transfers.

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.description: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Significant changes will be communicated via email or platform notifications.
changes.notification: Continued use of Qannoni after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: For privacy-related questions, concerns, or to exercise your rights, contact our Data Protection Officer:

faq.metaDescription: Find answers to common questions about Qannoni platform, document generation, digital signatures, billing, security, and more.
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our platform
faq.noResultsHint: Try different keywords or browse categories below

whatIsQannoni.question: What is Qannoni?
whatIsQannoni.answer: Qannoni is an AI-powered platform that helps individuals and businesses in the UAE and GCC region create, manage, and sign legal documents. We offer intelligent document generation, professional templates in multiple languages (English, Arabic, Urdu), and secure digital signature capabilities. Our platform is designed to make legal documentation faster, more accessible, and more affordable while ensuring compliance with local laws.

isLawFirm.question: Is Qannoni a law firm?
isLawFirm.answer: No, Qannoni is not a law firm and does not provide legal advice. We are a technology platform that provides tools for document creation and management. Our AI-generated documents and templates are designed to meet common legal requirements, but we strongly recommend consulting with a qualified lawyer for complex legal matters or if you have specific legal questions. For certain transactions, you may also need to have documents reviewed or notarized by legal professionals.

countries.question: What countries do you support?
countries.answer: Qannoni is primarily designed for the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and GCC (Gulf Cooperation Council) countries, including Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Qatar, Bahrain, and Oman. Our documents are tailored to comply with UAE legal frameworks and common practices in the region. However, our digital signature technology is accepted in many countries worldwide. If you're using our platform outside the GCC, please verify that our documents and signatures meet your local legal requirements.

languages.question: What languages are available?
languages.answer:
Qannoni supports three languages:

• English - Full support for all features
• Arabic - Full support including right-to-left text and native document generation
• Urdu - Full support with native document generation

You can switch between languages at any time, and all generated documents can be created in your preferred language. For bilingual documents, you can generate the same document in multiple languages and specify which version is legally binding.

dataSecurity.question: Is my data secure?
dataSecurity.answer:
Yes, we take security very seriously. All data is encrypted in transit (TLS 1.3) and at rest (AES-256 encryption). We use enterprise-grade security measures including:

• Encrypted data storage
• Secure authentication with 2FA support
• Regular security audits
• SOC 2 Type II compliance (in progress)
• GDPR-compliant data handling
• Regular backups in multiple geographic locations

Your documents are private and only accessible by you and the people you explicitly share them with. We never share your data with third parties for marketing purposes.

howAiWorks.question: How does AI document generation work?
howAiWorks.answer:
Our AI document generator uses advanced natural language processing to create professional legal documents. Here's how it works:

1. You select a document type (e.g., employment contract, NDA)
2. You answer simple questions about the parties, terms, and conditions
3. Our AI analyzes your inputs and generates a legally compliant document
4. You can review and edit the document using our editor
5. The document is ready to sign or download

The AI is trained on thousands of legal documents and understands legal terminology in English, Arabic, and Urdu. It ensures proper formatting, clause structure, and compliance with UAE legal requirements.

legallyValid.question: Are the documents legally valid?
legallyValid.answer:
Our documents are designed to be legally compliant and follow standard legal frameworks used in the UAE. However, legal validity depends on several factors:

• Proper execution by all parties
• Compliance with specific regulations for your situation
• Proper witnessing or notarization when required

While our documents are suitable for most common business and personal transactions, we recommend:

1. Having important documents reviewed by a qualified lawyer
2. Ensuring all parties understand the terms
3. Checking if notarization is required for your specific use case
4. Verifying compliance with any industry-specific regulations

LegalDocs is a tool to help you create documents, but final legal responsibility rests with the signing parties.

customizeTemplates.question: Can I customize templates?
customizeTemplates.answer:
Yes, absolutely! All templates and AI-generated documents are fully customizable:

• Edit text, clauses, and terms using our rich text editor
• Add or remove sections as needed
• Insert variables that auto-populate from party information
• Format text with headings, lists, and styling
• Add images, logos, or signatures
• Create your own templates from customized documents
• Save frequently used clauses for quick insertion

You have complete control over the final document. The templates and AI generations are starting points that you can modify to meet your specific needs.

documentTypes.question: What document types are available?
documentTypes.answer:
We offer a comprehensive library of legal document templates including:

Business Documents:
• Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDA)
• Service Agreements
• Memorandum of Understanding (MOU)
• Partnership Agreements
• Consulting Agreements

Employment:
• Employment Contracts
• Offer Letters
• Termination Letters
• Non-Compete Agreements

Real Estate:
• Rental Agreements (Tenancy Contracts)
• Deposit Receipts
• Property Sale Agreements
• Ejari Registration Support

Legal:
• Power of Attorney
• Affidavits
• Witness Statements
• Authorization Letters

We're constantly adding new templates based on user feedback. If you need a specific document type, let us know!

arabicTranslations.question: How accurate are the Arabic translations?
arabicTranslations.answer:
Our Arabic document generation is not simple translation - it's native content creation. We use:

• Native Arabic legal terminology
• Proper right-to-left formatting
• Culture-appropriate phrasing
• Legal terms commonly used in UAE courts and government

Our AI is trained on authentic Arabic legal documents from the region, ensuring proper legal language and cultural context. However, for critical documents, we recommend having a bilingual legal professional review the Arabic version to ensure it perfectly matches your intent, especially if it will be the legally binding version.

legalInUae.question: Are digital signatures legal in UAE?
legalInUae.answer:
Yes! Digital signatures are legally recognized in the UAE under:

• Federal Decree-Law No. 46 of 2021 on Electronic Transactions and Trust Services
• UAE Electronic Transactions Law
• Various emirate-specific regulations

Our e-signatures are legally binding for most commercial transactions. However, certain documents may require:

• Wet ink signatures (original handwritten)
• Notarization or attestation
• Government department approval

Examples requiring additional steps include property transfers, marriage contracts, wills, and some government submissions. Our platform will warn you if a document type typically requires notarization.

signingProcess.question: How does the signing process work?
signingProcess.answer:
Our signing process is simple and secure:

1. Document Preparation: Create or upload your document
2. Add Signers: Enter email addresses and names of all signers
3. Set Signing Order: Choose sequential or parallel signing
4. Send for Signature: Signers receive email notifications
5. Identity Verification: Signers verify their identity via SMS/email OTP
6. Review & Sign: Signers review the document and add their signature
7. Completion: All parties receive the signed document

Each signature includes:
• Time stamp
• IP address
• Identity verification proof
• Unique signature ID
• Complete audit trail

The signed document is tamper-proof and includes a certificate of authenticity.

mobileSupport.question: Can I sign documents on mobile?
mobileSupport.answer:
Yes! Our platform is fully mobile-responsive. You can:

• Review documents on any mobile device
• Sign using touch screen (draw signature)
• Type your signature
• Upload a signature image
• Receive and respond to signing requests
• Track document status

The mobile experience is optimized for both iOS and Android devices. No app download is required - everything works in your mobile browser. For the best experience, we recommend using the latest version of Safari (iOS) or Chrome (Android).

verification.question: How are signatures verified?
verification.answer:
We use multiple layers of verification:

1. Identity Verification:
   • SMS OTP to registered phone number
   • Email verification link
   • Optional: Emirates ID verification for high-value transactions

2. Document Integrity:
   • Cryptographic hash of the document
   • Tamper-evident sealing
   • Any changes invalidate the signature

3. Audit Trail:
   • Time stamps for all actions
   • IP address logging
   • Geographic location (when available)
   • Device information
   • Full activity log

Every signed document includes a verification certificate that can be used to prove authenticity. Third parties can verify the signature using our verification portal.

countries.question: What countries accept your e-signatures?
countries.answer:
Our e-signatures are accepted in:

• All GCC countries (UAE, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Qatar, Bahrain, Oman)
• Most EU countries under eIDAS regulation
• United States (under ESIGN Act and UETA)
• Many other countries with electronic signature laws

However, acceptance depends on:
• Document type
• Industry regulations
• Specific use case
• Local laws

Some countries or situations require specific certification levels (e.g., qualified electronic signatures in the EU). For international transactions, we recommend verifying that our signature method meets the requirements of all relevant jurisdictions.

Note: Government documents, property transfers, and certain legal filings may require wet signatures or notarization even in countries that accept e-signatures.

createAccount.question: How do I create an account?
createAccount.answer:
Creating an account is simple:

1. Click "Sign Up" in the top right corner
2. Choose your registration method:
   • Email and password
   • Phone number with OTP
   • Google account
   • Apple account
3. Verify your email or phone number
4. Complete your profile
5. Choose a plan (Free or Professional)

You can start using the platform immediately with the free plan. No credit card is required for the free tier.

freePlan.question: Is there a free plan?
freePlan.answer:
Yes! Our free plan includes:

• 3 document generations per month
• Access to all templates
• Basic document editing
• 5 signature requests per month
• Single language support
• Community support

Professional Plan ($29/month) includes:
• Unlimited document generation
• Unlimited signature requests
• All languages (English, Arabic, Urdu)
• Priority AI generation
• Advanced editor features
• Template customization
• Version history
• Priority email support
• API access
• Custom branding
• Bulk operations

Enterprise plans with custom features are available for larger organizations.

paymentMethods.question: What payment methods do you accept?
paymentMethods.answer:
We accept multiple payment methods:

• Credit/Debit Cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express
• Apple Pay
• Google Pay
• Bank Transfer (for annual plans)
• PayPal (coming soon)

All payments are processed securely through Stripe, and we never store your full card details. Payments are in USD or AED depending on your location.

For enterprise accounts, we can accommodate:
• Purchase orders
• Wire transfers
• Annual invoicing
• Multi-currency billing

cancelSubscription.question: Can I cancel my subscription?
cancelSubscription.answer:
Yes, you can cancel your subscription at any time:

1. Go to Settings > Billing
2. Click "Cancel Subscription"
3. Provide optional feedback
4. Confirm cancellation

When you cancel:
• You keep access until the end of your billing period
• No refunds for partial months
• Your documents remain accessible
• You can re-subscribe anytime
• You'll automatically downgrade to the free plan

We don't lock you in - no cancellation fees or penalties. If you cancel, we'd love to hear what we could have done better!

deleteAccount.question: How do I delete my account?
deleteAccount.answer:
To delete your account:

1. Go to Settings > Security
2. Scroll to "Delete Account"
3. Click "Delete My Account"
4. Confirm by entering your password
5. Acknowledge the data deletion warning

IMPORTANT: Deleting your account will:
• Permanently delete all your documents
• Remove all signatures and audit trails
• Cancel any active subscription
• Delete all personal data within 30 days
• This action cannot be undone

Before deleting:
• Download any documents you want to keep
• Ensure all pending signatures are complete
• Cancel any active subscriptions

We're required by law to keep certain transaction records for 7 years, but these are anonymized after account deletion.

dataProtection.question: How is my data protected?
dataProtection.answer:
We implement enterprise-grade security:

Encryption:
• TLS 1.3 for all data in transit
• AES-256 encryption for data at rest
• End-to-end encryption for sensitive documents
• Encrypted database backups

Access Control:
• Role-based access control (RBAC)
• Two-factor authentication (2FA)
• Session management and timeout
• IP whitelisting for enterprise accounts

Infrastructure:
• SOC 2 Type II certified data centers
• Redundant systems and backups
• DDoS protection
• 24/7 security monitoring
• Regular penetration testing
• Automated vulnerability scanning

Compliance:
• GDPR compliant
• ISO 27001 (in progress)
• Regular security audits
• Incident response plan

dataStorage.question: Where is data stored?
dataStorage.answer:
Your data is stored securely:

Primary Storage:
• AWS data centers in UAE (Dubai, Abu Dhabi)
• EU data centers (for European customers)
• All data remains within your chosen region

Backups:
• Daily encrypted backups
• Geographic redundancy (multiple data centers)
• 30-day backup retention
• Point-in-time recovery capability

We comply with UAE data residency requirements and GDPR regulations. For enterprise customers, we can accommodate specific data residency requirements.

Your data never leaves the approved regions unless you explicitly export it. We don't use your documents for AI training without explicit consent.

documentAccess.question: Who can access my documents?
documentAccess.answer:
Document access is strictly controlled:

By Default:
• Only you (the document creator)
• People you explicitly invite as signers
• Team members you add (on team plans)

LegalDocs Staff:
• No access to your documents under normal circumstances
• Access only with your explicit permission for support issues
• All access is logged and auditable
• Subject to strict confidentiality agreements

We will only access documents:
1. With your written permission for troubleshooting
2. If required by valid legal process (court order, subpoena)
3. For security investigations with your notification

You can:
• View full access logs for each document
• Revoke access at any time
• Set expiration dates for document links
• Require password protection for shared links
• Enable audit trail notifications

dataRetention.question: How long do you keep my data?
dataRetention.answer:
Our data retention policy:

Active Accounts:
• Documents: Kept indefinitely while your account is active
• Signatures: Kept for 7 years (legal requirement)
• Activity logs: 2 years
• Payment records: 7 years (legal requirement)

Deleted Documents:
• Moved to trash: 30 days
• Permanently deleted: Removed from active systems immediately
• Backup retention: 90 days from deletion
• Complete removal: Within 90 days

Closed Accounts:
• Account data deleted: 30 days after closure
• Legal records: 7 years (anonymized)
• Signatures and audit trails: 7 years (legal requirement)

You can request:
• Immediate deletion of specific documents
• Export of all your data
• Deletion of your account and data

Note: We're legally required to retain certain transaction and signature records for compliance purposes, but these are anonymized after account deletion.

gdprCompliant.question: Are you GDPR compliant?
gdprCompliant.answer:
Yes, we are fully GDPR compliant. Your rights include:

Right to Access:
• Request all data we hold about you
• Receive data in portable format
• Access within 30 days

Right to Rectification:
• Correct inaccurate data
• Update incomplete data
• Real-time self-service updates

Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten):
• Delete your account and data
• Remove specific documents
• Exception: legally required records

Right to Restriction:
• Limit how we process your data
• Object to certain processing
• Opt-out of marketing

Right to Data Portability:
• Export your data in JSON/PDF format
• Transfer to another service

Right to Object:
• Object to automated decision making
• Opt-out of profiling

We also:
• Have a Data Protection Officer
• Conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments
• Maintain records of processing activities
• Report data breaches within 72 hours
• Use privacy by design principles

browsers.question: What browsers are supported?
browsers.answer:
Qannoni works best on modern browsers:

Fully Supported:
• Google Chrome (version 90+)
• Microsoft Edge (version 90+)
• Safari (version 14+)
• Firefox (version 88+)

Mobile Browsers:
• Safari on iOS 14+
• Chrome on Android 10+
• Samsung Internet 14+

Features that require modern browsers:
• Digital signature pad
• Document preview
• Real-time collaboration
• Drag-and-drop file upload

For the best experience:
• Enable JavaScript
• Allow cookies
• Use the latest browser version
• Enable pop-ups for document downloads

Internet Explorer is not supported. If you're on a corporate network with browser restrictions, please contact your IT department to whitelist *.qannoni.com

offline.question: Can I use Qannoni offline?
offline.answer:
Qannoni requires an internet connection for most features:

Requires Internet:
• Document generation
• Saving and syncing
• Sending for signature
• Real-time collaboration
• Template browsing

Limited Offline Capability:
• View recently opened documents (cached)
• Read-only access to downloaded PDFs
• Mobile apps have offline document viewing

Coming Soon:
• Progressive Web App (PWA) with offline editing
• Sync when connection is restored
• Offline signature capability

Workaround:
• Download documents as PDF for offline access
• Edit offline in your preferred app
• Upload edited versions when online

For industries requiring offline capability (ships, remote locations), please contact us about our enterprise offline solution.

exportDocuments.question: How do I export documents?
exportDocuments.answer:
You can export documents in multiple formats:

PDF Export:
• High-quality PDF with fonts embedded
• Preserves formatting and signatures
• Includes audit trail and certificate
• Watermark options for drafts

Word Export (DOCX):
• Editable Microsoft Word format
• Maintains basic formatting
• Useful for further editing
• Available on Professional plan

Other Formats:
• HTML for web publishing
• Plain text (TXT)
• Markdown for documentation

Bulk Export:
• Export multiple documents at once
• Organized in folders by type/date
• Includes metadata CSV
• ZIP file download

To Export:
1. Open the document
2. Click "Download" or "Export"
3. Choose format
4. Select options (signatures, watermark, etc.)
5. Click "Download"

Signatures and audit trails are included in PDF exports but may be lost in other formats.

fileFormats.question: What file formats are supported?
fileFormats.answer:
Supported formats:

Document Upload:
• PDF (.pdf) - Most common
• Microsoft Word (.docx, .doc)
• Rich Text Format (.rtf)
• Plain Text (.txt)
• Markdown (.md)

Export Formats:
• PDF (.pdf) - Recommended
• Word (.docx)
• HTML (.html)
• Plain Text (.txt)

Image Upload (for logos, signatures):
• PNG (recommended for transparency)
• JPEG/JPG
• SVG (vector graphics)
• GIF
• WebP

File Size Limits:
• Free plan: 10 MB per file
• Professional plan: 50 MB per file
• Enterprise: Custom limits

For best results:
• Use PDF for finalized documents
• Use DOCX for templates
• Use PNG for logos and signatures
• Compress large files before upload

api.question: Is there an API?
api.answer:
Yes! We offer a REST API for Professional and Enterprise customers:

API Capabilities:
• Generate documents programmatically
• Send for signature
• Check signature status
• Retrieve signed documents
• Webhook notifications
• Bulk operations

Common Use Cases:
• Integration with CRM systems
• Automated contract generation
• HR system integration
• E-commerce order confirmations
• Automated tenant agreements

API Features:
• RESTful endpoints
• JSON request/response
• OAuth 2.0 authentication
• Rate limiting
• Comprehensive documentation
• Code examples (Node.js, Python, PHP)
• Sandbox environment for testing
• Webhook support for real-time updates

To Get Started:
1. Upgrade to Professional or Enterprise
2. Go to Settings > API Keys
3. Generate an API key
4. Read our API documentation
5. Start integrating

API Documentation: https://docs.qannoni.com/api
Support: api-support@qannoni.com

uaeLaws.question: What UAE laws do you follow?
uaeLaws.answer:
Our platform is designed to comply with:

Electronic Transactions:
• Federal Decree-Law No. 46 of 2021 on Electronic Transactions
• UAE Electronic Transactions Law
• Dubai Electronic Transactions Regulations

Data Protection:
• UAE Data Protection Law
• Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) Data Protection Law
• Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM) Data Protection Regulations

Commercial Law:
• UAE Commercial Companies Law
• UAE Civil Code
• UAE Labour Law (for employment contracts)

Document Specific:
• Tenancy Law (for rental agreements)
• Real Estate Regulatory Agency (RERA) requirements
• Various free zone regulations

Important Notes:
• We follow best practices and common legal standards
• Specific transactions may require additional compliance
• Free zones may have specific requirements
• Always verify requirements for your specific situation
• Consult a lawyer for complex matters

We regularly update our templates to reflect legal changes.

governmentUse.question: Are documents valid for government use?
governmentUse.answer:
It depends on the specific government requirement:

Generally Accepted:
• Business licenses applications (supporting docs)
• Commercial contracts
• Internal company documents
• Employment offer letters
• Service agreements

May Require Additional Steps:
• Property transfers (need notarization)
• Tenancy contracts (may need Ejari registration)
• Power of Attorney (requires notarization)
• Immigration documents (require attestation)
• Court filings (may need wet signatures)

Government Portals:
• Some accept uploaded PDFs
• Others require specific formats
• Digital signatures acceptance varies by department

Recommendations:
1. Check specific government department requirements
2. Ask if digital signatures are accepted
3. Verify if notarization is needed
4. Check if attestation is required
5. Keep both digital and printed copies

For Ejari (Dubai tenancy registration):
• Our tenancy contracts meet RERA requirements
• You can upload our PDFs to Ejari portal
• Signatures must be present before registration

When in doubt, contact the specific government department to confirm their requirements.

notarization.question: Do I need to notarize generated documents?
notarization.answer:
Notarization requirements depend on the document type and use:

Usually Require Notarization:
• Power of Attorney
• Property sale agreements
• Mortgage documents
• Wills and testaments
• Some affidavits
• Documents for government submission
• International use documents

Usually Don't Require Notarization:
• Employment contracts
• Service agreements
• Non-disclosure agreements (NDA)
• Internal company documents
• Vendor agreements
• Most business contracts

Notarization Process in UAE:
1. Complete document on LegalDocs
2. Print the document
3. Visit notary public or court
4. Present Emirates ID
5. Sign in presence of notary
6. Pay notarization fees
7. Receive notarized document

Notary Locations in UAE:
• UAE Courts (most emirates)
• Notary Public offices
• DIFC Courts (for DIFC entities)
• ADGM Courts (for ADGM entities)
• Typing centers (some have notary services)

Costs:
• Vary by document type and emirate
• Typically AED 50-200 per document
• Translation costs if needed

Our platform will display a warning if a document typically requires notarization.

courtProceedings.question: Can I use these for court proceedings?
courtProceedings.answer:
Documents can be used in court, but with important considerations:

Admissibility:
• Electronic documents are generally admissible as evidence
• Digital signatures are recognized under UAE law
• Court may require authentication of digital signatures
• Original documents may be requested

Best Practices for Court Use:
1. Keep original digital copies with audit trails
2. Print and have parties sign physical copies for backup
3. Maintain complete signature verification records
4. Keep all email communications and notifications
5. Document the signing process
6. Have a lawyer review before relying on for litigation

Court Requirements:
• Some courts prefer wet signatures
• Notarization may strengthen the document
• Translation may be required (Arabic for UAE courts)
• Authentication of electronic signatures may be needed

Types of Court Proceedings:

Civil Cases (contracts, disputes):
• Our documents are suitable as evidence
• Include the signature verification certificate
• Print the audit trail

Labour Cases:
• Employment contracts are admissible
• Ministry of Labour may require specific formats
• Keep signed copies for both parties

Commercial Cases:
• Business agreements are generally accepted
• Strong audit trail is beneficial
• Court may verify signatures

Recommendations:
• If you anticipate litigation, have documents notarized
• Consult a lawyer before relying on documents for court
• Keep comprehensive records of the signing process
• Consider having a lawyer draft or review critical documents

For court use, we recommend our Professional plan which includes enhanced audit trails and verification features.

stillNeedHelp.title: Still need help?
stillNeedHelp.description: Can't find the answer you're looking for? Our support team is here to help.
